Serve them up with a little grated Parmesan or Romano over the top Drain your cooked up ravioli dump them in the butter sauce and get them good and coated Now drop in your chopped basil give it a swirl or two to let the basil wilt and your butter sauce is ready to rumble Grab another pan drop the butter into it and cook it on medium until it turns a beautiful golden brown and gives off a lovely nutty smell At this point youll turn the heat down just a notch and add in your garlic Grab a pot fill it up with water and set it to boil The pasta will cook up quick it will float when cooked Brush the edges with an egg wash the egg white from one egg and place another pasta piece over the top Seal the edges with your fingers a fork or whatever puts a smile on your face After you have your ravioli cut out youll drop a good teaspoonful of the prosciutto mixture into the center of the pasta If you have a ravioli cutter you can use that or you can use a glass to cut circles or you can do like we did and use a cookie cutter to make fun shapes celebrating the holiday Rip off about a sixth of the ball and run it through your pasta maker or hand roll it to the desired thinness Now its time to grab your well rested pasta dough and pop out some ravioli Let the spinach wilt down completely and then remove the mixture from the heat Let it cook up for a minute or two and then add in the salt and oregano Give it a swirl or two around the pan to mix in and then add in your spinach Next well add in the proscuitto onions and mushrooms While your dough is resting lets whip up the tasty filling Grab your skillet and heat up the butter on medium heat Now add in the garlic Cover your ball of pasta dough with plastic wrap and let it rest for a good twenty minutes Run the processor and mix the ingredients up well If the dough looks like pebbles its a touch too dry Add about 121 tsp of water and mix again It should form a nice ball of dough Once your dough is mixed bring it out of
